lines.text: It shames me to be the son of a pig.
You'll grow out of it. Just thank your stars you weren't born a half-breed like your demon sisters.
You should have been born a female the way you whine and whimper.
You've got a lot of salt calling yourself a father at all.
It was forced upon me by cruel nature. I never had a say in the business. No, sir! A father is not my calling in this life.
My sister is sending you her thoughts.
She is my mother's weapon. She's moving on you now with vengeance.
I'm telling you now, if we don't turn back, their dogs'll be eatin' our testicles by nightfall.
He just stands over her corpse like a lost soul, watchin, speakin' tongues, guarding, as though she were still in the world.
Well, he'll soon get over that business. You know how the heart goes. Give him time. After all, 'twas only his first wife.
